tuv.seg: Witnesses under 18 years
Finnéithe faoi 18 mbliana
• Giving evidence by video link
• Fianaise a thabhairt le nasc teilifíse
Children and young people who are required to go to court as witnesses are most often either the victims of crime or witnesses to crimes
Go hiondúil is daoine iad a d'fhulaing coir nó a bhí ina bhfinnéithe ag coir iad leanaí agus daoine óga gur gá dóibh freastal ar an gcúirt mar fhinnéithe

Going to court is regarded by most people as a daunting prospect and children and young people may feel anxious about the prospect and will need extra support and reassurance from parents, guardians or carers in advance of and during this time

Don chuid is mó daoine tá sé scanrúil dul chuig an gcúirt agus tá gach seans ann go mbeidh imní ar leanaí agus ar dhaoine óga faoi agus teastóidh tacaíocht bhreise uathu agus a bheith curtha ar a suaimhneas ag a tuismitheoirí, caomhnóirí nó cúramóirí roimh agus le linn an ama seo
Cases at which children and young people can give evidence can be heard in the District Court, the Circuit Court or the Central Criminal Court
Is féidir cásanna inár féidir le leanaí agus le daoine óga fianaise a thabhairt a éisteacht sa Chúirt Dúiche, sa Chúirt Chuarda nó sa Chúirt Choiriúil Lárnach
Before a child or young person is required to go to court to give evidence, it is important to explain the several steps involved in taking a case to court
Tá sé tábhachtach cur síos a dhéanamh don leanbh nó don duine óg atá le fianaise a thabhairt sa chúirt céard go díreach atá i gceist le cás a thabhairt chun na cúirte
A complaint is made to the Gardaí that identifies the child or young person as a victim of, or witness to, a crime
Déantar gearán leis an nGarda ina ainmnítear an leanbh nó an duine óg mar an té a d'fhulaing nó a chonaic coir ag tarlú
A Garda officer then interviews the child or young person
Cuireann oifigeach den Gharda agallamh ansin ar an leanbh nó ar an duine óg
Following consideration of all the allegations made, the Gardaí may decide to:
Tar éis machnaimh a dhéanamh ar na líomhaintí atá déanta, d'fhéadfadh an Garda cinneadh a dhéanamh:
• Interview the defendant about what the child or young person has said and send the file to the Director of Public Prosecutions, or
• Agallamh a chur ar an gcosantóir maidir leis an méid a dúirt an leanbh nó an duine óg agus cód a sheoladh chuig Stiúrthóir na nIonchúiseamh Poiblí, nó
• Arrest the defendant on warrant, or
• An cosantóir a ghabháil ar bharántas, nó
• Charge the defendant with an offence or
• An cosantóir a chúiseamh le coir nó
• Issue a summons for the defendant to appear in court
• Toghairm a eisiúint don chosantóir a bheith i láthair sa chúirt
The Director of Public Prosecutions
Stiúrthóir na nIonchúiseamh Poiblí

The Gardaí inform the Office of the Director of Public Prosecutions (DPP) about the case and provide information as to how the child or young person and their parents/guardians/carers feel about the child or young person giving evidence in court

Cuireann an Garda tuairisc maidir leis an gcás chuig Stiúrthóir na nIonchúiseamh Poiblí (SIP) agus cuirtear eolas ar fáil freisin maidir leis an dearcadh atá ag an leanbh nó duine óg agus ag a t(h)uismitheoirí/c(h)aomhnóirí/c(h)úramóirí maidir leis an leanbh nó an duine óg a bheith glaoite chun na cúirte le fianaise a thabhairt
The DPP makes an independent decision about whether or not to proceed with the prosecution, which means that the child or young person may or may not be required to give evidence
I bhfocail eile, déanfaidh SIP cinneadh an leanfar leis an gcúiseamh, rud a fhágann nach i gcónaí a bhíonn iallach ar an leanbh nó duine óg fianaise a thabhairt
Criminal cases commence in the District Court where the judge sits without a jury
Cuirtear tús le gach cás coiriúil sa Chúirt Dúiche ina bhfuil breitheamh i láthair gan aon ghiúiré
Cases involving minor assaults are decided in the District Court
Déantar cinneadh maidir le mionionsaithe sa Chúirt Dúiche
Cases involving more serious assaults or serious offences against property are sent forward for trial to the Circuit Court
Cuirtear cásanna ina bhfuil mórionsaithe nó coireanna troma i dtaobh maoine i gceist ar aghaidh le triail sa Chúirt Chuarda
Cases involving murder, rape, aggravated sexual assault, treason, piracy, etc., must be heard in the Central Criminal Court
Ní mór do chásanna ina bhfuil dúnmharú, éigniú, mórionsaí gnéis, tréas, píoráideacht & rl i gceist a éisteacht sa Chúirt Choiriúil Lárnach
In both the Circuit and Central Criminal Courts, the judge sits with a jury
Bíonn breitheamh agus giúiré i láthair sa Chúirt Chuarda agus sa Chúirt Choiriúil Lárnach
If a witness is 14 years of age or over, he/she will be required to give evidence on oath or affirmation
Má tá finné 14 bliana d'aois nó níos mó beidh air/uirthi fianaise a thabhairt faoi mhionn nó dearbhú
Children under 14 years are not required to swear an oath or make an affirmation before giving evidence
Ní gá do leanaí atá faoi 14 bliana d'aois mionn nó dearbhú a dhéanamh roimh dóibh fianaise a thabhairt
In some cases involving sexual offences, the judge may decide that members of the public should not be allowed in court
I gcásanna faoi leith ina bhfuil coireanna gnéis i gceist is féidir leis an mbreitheamh cinneadh a dhéanamh nach bhfuil cead ag baill an phobail a bheith i láthair sa chúirt
If your child is appearing as a witness in court, it is important not to rehearse the child's evidence
Má bhíonn do leanbh ag tabhairt fianaise sa chúirt tá sé tábhachtach gan an fhianaise a chleachtadh leis/léi
The case is likely to fail if the child appears to have been "coached"
Tá gach seans go dteipfidh ar an gcás má bhíonn an cuma ar an scéal go bhfuair an leanbh "traenáil"
The prosecution can give you more advice on this
Beidh na cúisitheoirí in ann comhairle a chur ort ina thaobh seo
Giving evidence by video link
Fianaise a thabhairt le nasc teilifíse

In cases involving a sexual offence or an offence involving violence, Section 13 of the Criminal Evidence Act 1992 allows for children under 17 years of age and people with intellectual disabilities to give evidence from a separate room using a video link

I gcásanna a bhaineann le cion gnéasach nó cion lena ngabhann foréigean ceadaíonn Alt 13 den Acht um Fhianaise Choiriúil 1992 do leanaí faoi bhun 17 mbliana d'aois agus daoine faoi mhíchumas intleachtúil fianaise a thabhairt as seomra ar leith ag baint úsáide as nasc físeáin
unless there is a good reason why they should not
ach amháin má tá cúis mhaith cén fáth nach ba chóir dóibh
Instead of coming into the courtroom, the witness sits in another room and gives evidence via a live television link
In áit a theacht isteach i seomra na cúirte bíonn an finné suite i seomra eile agus tugann sé/sí fianaise tríd nasc beo teilifíse

A television monitor is placed in the court, which transmits the image of the witness, and the witness has the benefit of a television monitor in his/her room that transmits the image of what is going on in the court
Cuirtear teilifíseán isteach sa chúirt, a thaispeáineann an finné agus bíonn teilifíseán ina s(h)eomra féin ag an bhfinné gur féidir leis/léi a bhfuil ag tarlú sa seomra cúirte a fheiceáil
This means that your child does not have to go into the courtroom or see the defendant
Ciallaíonn sé sin níl gcaitheann do leanbh dul isteach sa seomra cúirte nó an cosantóir a fheiceáil
When evidence is being given by a child through a live TV link, the judge and the barristers in the court do not wear wigs or gowns
Nuair atá leanbh nó duine faoi mhíchumas intleachtúil ag tabhairt fianaise tríd nasc beo teilifíse ní bhíonn bréagfhoilt ná róbaí dhá gcaitheamh ag an mbreitheamh ná ag na habhchóidí sa chúirt

The judge may decide that the questions should be asked through an intermediary (for example a social worker) and that they should be asked in a way that is appropriate for the age and mental ability of the witness

Is féidir leis an mbreitheamh cinneadh a dhéanamh go mbeadh na ceisteanna curtha tríd idirghabhálaí (oibrí sóisialta mar shampla) agus go mbeadh siad curtha ar bhealach atá oiriúnach d'aois agus do chumas intinne an fhinné

Section 16 of the Criminal Evidence Act 1992 allows for video recording of statements of victims under 14 years of age to be admitted as evidence in criminal proceedings in relation to sexual offences or offences involving violence

Forálann Alt 16 den Acht um Fhianaise Choiriúil 1992 d'fhístaifeadadh ar ráitis ó íospartaigh faoi bhun 14 bliana d'aois a ghlacadh i bhfianaise in imeachtaí coiriúla i ndáil le cionta gnéasacha nó cionta a bhfuil foréigean i gceist
The law allows for the video recording of the statement to be admitted in place of the child having to give live testimony (evidence) in open court
Forálann an dlí do ghlacadh le fístaifeadadh ar an ráiteas in ionad fianaise bheo ón leanbh i gcúirt oscailte
This also removes the requirement of the child witness having to physically confront and re-identify the accused in court
Cuireann sé seo deireadh freisin leis an riachtanas go mbeadh ar an bhfinné linbh aghaidh a thabhairt go fisiciúil ar an gcúisí, agus é a athchéannú, sa chúirt
There are a number of rules regarding the admissibility of this video recording of statements
Tá roinnt rialacha ann maidir le hinghlacacht an fhístaifeadta seo ar ráitis
• The video recording must be relevant
• Caithfidh an fístaifeadadh a bheith ábhartha

• The child witness must be available for cross-examination by the defence at the trial following the playing of the tape (although cross-examination may be via television link and using an intermediary)

• Caithfidh an finné linbh a bheith ar fáil do chroscheistiú ón gcosaint ag an triail i ndiaidh an fhístéip a chasadh (cé go bhféadfaí an croscheistiú a dhéanamh trí nasc teilifíse agus trí idirghabhálaí a úsáid)
• The prosecution must serve notice of its intention to admit a videotaped interview in evidence and must give the accused a reasonable opportunity to view the videotape

• Caithfidh an t-ionchúiseamh fógra a sheirbheáil go bhfuil sé ar intinn acu agallamh fístaifeadta a ghlacadh i bhfianaise, agus caithfidh siad deis réasúnta a thabhairt don chúisí féachaint ar an bhfístéip
• An edited version of the videotape may be played to the court but only if the accused consents and the judge allows it
• D'fhéadfaí leagan den fhístéip atá curtha in eagar a chasadh sa chúirt ar an gcoinníoll go dtoilfeadh an cúisí leis agus go gceadódh an breitheamh é
Ultimately, it is at the discretion of the trial judge whether to allow a videotape to be admitted in evidence
I ndeireadh na dála, is faoi rogha bhreitheamh na trialach é cead a thabhairt maidir le fístéip a ghlacadh i bhfianaise
The judge has to consider whether there is any risk that the admission of the videotape will result in unfairness to the accused
Ní mór don bhreitheamh breathnú ar aon riosca a d'fhéadfadh a bheith ann go dtiocfadh leatrom ar an gcúisí as glacadh leis an bhfístéip i bhfianaise
The statements of victims under 14 years of age can be made during an interview with a Garda or other competent person
Is féidir ráitis ó íospartaigh faoi bhun 14 bliana d'aois a dhéanamh le linn agallaimh le ball den Gharda Síochána nó le duine inniúil eile
The competent person in such a situation would be the professional person who assesses the young person as a result of an abuse case which is being investigated
Is é an duine inniúil i gcúinse mar sin ná an duine gairmiúil a dhéanann measúnú ar an duine óg de thoradh cáis mhí-úsáidte atá á iniúchadh

All the provisions which relate to the video-recording of statements made by victims under 14 years of age and the admissibility of such videotapes in a court also apply to any victim with an intellectual disability

Tá feidhm ag na forálacha uile atá bainteach le fístaifeadadh ráiteas ó íospartaigh faoi bhun 14 bliana d'aois agus le hinghlacacht fístéipeanna dá leithéid i gcúirt ar aon íospartach faoi mhíchumas intleachta freisin
For more detailed information you should seek legal advice
Ba chóir duit comhairle dlí a lorg chun faisnéis mionsonraithe a fháil
